snippet: The deeply dismaying decision in the Hobby Lobby case grants owners of closely held companies an unprecedented right to impose their religious views on their workers.
abstract: Editorial expresses deep dismay about Supreme Court decision granting employers the right to deny health benefits like contraception coverage based on their religious views; argues ruling is a radical departure from court's history of resisting claims of religious exemption from neutral laws when those exemptions would cause harm.
lead_paragraph: The deeply dismaying decision in the Hobby Lobby case grants owners of closely held companies an unprecedented right to impose their religious views on their workers.

headline.main: Limiting Rights: Imposing Religion on Workers
headline.print_headline: The Justices Endorse Imposing Religion on Employees
